data.name: ContentAbout
data.value:
Our website aims to provide several customized services to the user, whether the user is a patient or a doctor, as the site has several features and advantages, for example:
the site allows to register an account of its own, in order to maintain security and provide features for the registered account. For example, there are four fixed services that Provided by the site to the user.

data.name: ContentDisease_1
data.value: Tuberculosis (TB) is a bacterial infection spread through inhaling tiny droplets from the coughs or sneezes of an infected person. It mainly affects the lungs, but it can affect any part of the body, including the tummy (abdomen), glands, bones and nervous system.

data.name: ContentDisease_2
data.value: Pneumonia is swelling (inflammation) of the tissue in one or both lungs. It's usually caused by a bacterial infection or a virus. The symptoms of pneumonia can develop suddenly over 24 to 48 hours, or they may come on more slowly over several days. Pneumonia is usually the result of a bacterial infection.

data.name: ContentDisease_3
data.value: Lung cancer is a type of cancer that begins in the lungs. Your lungs are two spongy organs in your chest that take in oxygen when you inhale and release carbon dioxide when you exhale. Lung cancer is the leading cause of cancer deaths worldwide.

data.name: ContentDisease_4
data.value: coronaviruses are a type of virus. There are many different kinds, and some cause disease. A coronavirus identified in 2019, SARS-CoV-2, has caused a pandemic of respiratory illness, called COVID-19. The coronavirus can be spread from person to person.

data.name: ContentDisease_5
data.value: Asthma is a condition in which your airways narrow and swell and may produce extra mucus. This can make breathing difficult and trigger coughing, a whistling sound (wheezing) when you breathe out and shortness of breath.

data.name: ContentDisease_6
data.value: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease is a leading cause of death and disability, but has only recently been extensively explored from a cellular and molecular perspective. The inflammation and proteolysis in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease is an amplification of the normal inflammatory response to cigarette smoke.

data.name: ContentDisease_7
data.value: Pulmonary hypertension (PH) is high blood pressure in the lungs. This means that the blood vessels that carry blood from the heart to the lungs become hard and narrow, making the heart work harder to pump the blood through.

data.name: ContentDisease_8
data.value: A pulmonary embolism is a blood clot that blocks and stops blood flow to an artery in the lung. In most cases, the blood clot starts in a deep vein in the leg and travels to the lung. Rarely, the clot forms in a vein in another part of the body. When a blood clot forms in one or more of the deep veins in the body, it's called a deep vein thrombosis (DVT).

data.name: ContentService_1
data.value: The medical advice blog aims to increase awareness among patients, increase the effectiveness of communication between patients and doctors, and facilitate knowledge of the risks of diseases, as well as the medical reasons that avoid these diseases.

data.name: ContentService_2
data.value: The disease detection process is useful for discovering a group of serious diseases that affect human health and that may lead to death if they are not resisted, such as pneumonia, tuberculosis and lung cancer.

data.name: ContentService_3
data.value: This box aims to measure the temperature, heartbeat and blood oxygen level to a large extent Accurate proportion, this is intended to show the initial indications of the patient's condition, as if an abnormality had occurred In any of them, it is seen that certain symptoms of the respiratory tract and breathing appear.

data.name: ContentService_4
data.value: The Doctor's Patient Management and Follow-Up System is designed to streamline patient care by providing an all-in-one platform for doctors to manage patient records, schedule follow-ups, and track treatment progress efficiently. This feature enhances doctor-patient communication, ensures timely follow-ups, and improves the overall healthcare experience.

data.name: ContentSlider_1
data.value:
The Patient Safety Initiative aims to increase the process of awareness among the community in order to maintain public safety for all, especially from lung syndrome diseases related to the breathing process, and to find appropriate solutions through programs and blogs that allow this,
whether in order to facilitate knowledge of the disease itself or finding treatment and solutions that Help with that.

data.name: ContentSlider_2
data.value: The Doctor's Patient Management and Follow-Up System is designed to streamline patient care by providing an all-in-one platform for doctors to manage patient records, schedule follow-ups, and track treatment progress efficiently. This feature enhances doctor-patient communication, ensures timely follow-ups, and improves the overall healthcare experience.

data.name: ContentSlider_3
data.value:
You probably already know that smoking increases your risk of lung cancer. But this is not the only disease that can cause it. In fact, smoking is associated with most lung diseases, including chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, and asthma.
It also makes smokers more likely to die. Smoking also causes lungs to age more rapidly. Eventually, the chemicals can change lung cells from normal to cancerous.
